DataElement.preferredName: Material Process Step Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Personal Medical History Flag ISO21090.BL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed act of processing a material. EXAMPLE(S): freezing, thawing, spinning, embedding, dividing, aliquot, adding additives or growth factors OTHER NAME(S): product manipulation NOTE(S): Material process may be performed on any kind of material, such as specimen, nanomaterial, or biologic. The result of the process may be similar or different kind of material, e.g. specimen may be result of specimen processing step (aliquot or division of a specimen), or alternatively blood product has anticoagulants added to it to preserve product. Other processing steps, e.g. adding growth factor to induce cell growth, may be performed on blood product. Specifies whether the activity is considered part of the historical record of a subject, that is, it did not occur within the bounds of the study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Material Process Step Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Personal Medical History Flag
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.:A sequence of events which produces some outcome.:A specific stage of progression through a sequential process.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Material Process Step Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.:A sequence of events which produces some outcome.:A specific stage of progression through a sequential process.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Concepts.definition: The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.
A sequence of events which produces some outcome.
A specific stage of progression through a sequential process.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader
Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
